text: Patarei Prison The model of Patarei Prison Patarei Prison (, also Patarei Sea Fortress-Prison, also Tallinn Central Prison (), or simply The Battery ()) was a sea fortress and prison overlooking the harbour in Tallinn, Estonia. Nowadays, it is adapted as the Culture Park. The area of the complex is about 4 ha. The complex was built from 1828–1840. The order for the building was given by emperor Nicholas I. After World War I, in 1920 the complex's main function became a prison, lasting until 2002. Since 2007, this abandoned prison is adapted as the Culture Park. ==See also== *Tallinn Prison ==References== ==External links== Category:Prisons in Estonia Category:Buildings and structures in Tallinn Category:7 Most Endangered Programme
title: Patarei Prison
